definition: to hand over/to pass on sth/to gradually increase or decrease/progressively

sentences.english: I will have the parcel expressed to your office by a courier.
sentences.chinese: 我會請速遞員將郵包快捷傳遞到你的辦公室。

sentences.english: The oven can be a bottleneck; its size and speed determine the rate of production.
sentences.chinese: 烤箱的大小和加熱速遞決定了產品的等級。

sentences.english: City Express East corner extension soldiers reported.
sentences.chinese: 城市速遞東隅延兵報道。

sentences.english: And the new VGA splitter is express delivered today.
sentences.chinese: 新的視頻分配器今天被速遞到了。

sentences.english: Mail your return by certified mail or use a delivery service.
sentences.chinese: 通過保證郵件或速遞服務來寄送申報表。

sentences.english: And then to the admissibility of post operational test and receive the admission ticket booking and express certificates.
sentences.chinese: 然後到業務受理崗預約考試並領取准考證和速遞憑證。

definition: to pass through a country's territory/transit
mainland China (PRC excluding Hong Kong and Macau, but including islands such as Hainan)/Japan (used in Taiwan during Japanese colonization)
network (computer, telecom)/Internet/Taiwanese term for 網絡|网络[wang3 luo4]
